item.title: 8 Most Iconic Sonic the Hedgehog Characters
item.description:
Summary

  • Sonic is an iconic rival to Super Mario, with over 30 years of popularity.
  • Dr. Eggman, Sonic's nemesis, is an eccentric villain beloved for humor.
  • Tails evolves from sidekick to well-developed character in Sonic's world.

Sonic the Hedgehog has, for over 30 years, held a wide presence in the gaming world. The series is known for its high-speed action, lovable and unique characters and a detailed narrative which takes place across a large and colorful world.

From the Classic era to the most recent games and everything in between, over the years many new faces have joined Sonic's ever-increasing character roster. Yet, there are certain iconic Sonic characters which have remained the face of the franchise for many years and have always been extremely popular. Whether one of the earliest characters, sidekick or beloved anti hero, these characters, both heroes and villains, are staples of the franchise.

1 Sonic the Hedgehog

The Iconic Figurehead

The iconic blue mascot of the franchise, Sonic has been around for a long time and, as such, is a very recognizable icon even to those unfamiliar with the franchise. Sonic was designed to replace Alex Kidd as the new mascot for Sega in the '90s, and with it a new franchise was born. Known for his speed and witty personality, Sonic has remained popular for over 30 years.

Sonic is very well known for being a direct rival to Nintendo’s Super Mario . More recently, Sonic made the crossover to the world of cinema, and with three new movies under his belt already, the Blue Blur's journey is far from over.

2 Dr. Eggman

An Extremely Recognizable Villain

Sonic’s overarching nemesis, Dr. Ivo Robotnik, mostly known as Eggman, is both one of the most iconic Sonic characters and among the most iconic villains in the entirety of videogames. This evil scientist, with his trademark appearance, high IQ and many evil yet eccentric plans for world domination, has menaced Sonic ever since the very first game, when he tried to destroy Sonic's homeland in search of the Chaos Emeralds.

Since then, Sonic has taken down the mad doctor time and time again, whether it's his mind-control ray and interstellar amusement park, or laying waste to his many robot henchmen or other evil beings under his control. Eggman is a popular character for the comic relief he brings, his wacky and eccentric ideas and undeniable perseverance, which makes him very memorable.

3 Tails the Fox

The Trusty Sidekick

Tails is mostly known for being Sonic’s trusty sidekick and best friend, debuting only a year after the Blue Blur himself. Tails is one of the cutest and most gentle characters, yet he’s also extremely powerful, being able to run at speeds similar to Sonic and carry him by flying with his twin tails.

Tails has remained by Sonic's side for the longest time, yet he’s also come a long way as a character, learning to not just rely on Sonic but on himself and that he’s not just living in Sonic’s shadow. This character growth is seen in titles like Sonic Adventure and Sonic Frontiers . His shift from sidekick to a mainstay and well-developed character means he remains extremely popular to this day, and he even has a niche collection of self-titled games to his name.

4 Knuckles the Echidna

Sonic's Initial Rival

The red echidna debuted in Sonic the Hedgehog 3 as Sonic’s main rival, which presented a new dynamic between Sonic and another character. Knuckles instantly became a beloved character for this, but was also popular for his eye-catching design and his personal story. He’s the last of his kind and his lonely, stoic journey as the last guardian of the mysterious Master Emerald intrigued fans.

Knuckles is extremely strong, and when he eventually becomes Sonic’s friend, he makes up Team Sonic’s brute strength, alongside Tails' genius and Sonic's speed, making for an unstoppable trio. Knuckles is well-loved for the humor, rivalry, and brawn he brings to the franchise.

5 Amy-Rose the Hedgehog

A Close Friend Of Sonic

The first female character in the franchise debuted only a year after Sonic’s trusty sidekick. Amy is known for her energetic yet fierce personality and persistence in everything she does, and most of the time she puts this into trying to win Sonic’s heart. Since her rescue by him in the events of Sonic CD , Amy has consistently pursued Sonic and accompanied him on his many adventures. like Tails, she has received quite a bit of character development over the years.

Amy is mostly depicted with her iconic Piko Piko hammer, which she can wield with brute strength and speed to take down many opponents. Her optimism also encourages those around her and gives her the qualities of a good leader.

6 Metal Sonic

Eggman's Evil Duplicate Of The Blue Blur

Sonic has had many rivals over the years, but Metal Sonic is one of his most deadly. This fierce metal duplicate is one of Eggman's most powerful robots, and he can easily reach Sonic speeds, and sports a sleek yet menacing design which closely resembles Sonic.

Metal Sonic was very popular in the Classic era, from his debut in Sonic CD to the iconic OVA movie, and remains a beloved character to this day. He has made an appearance in a number of games and has even made a crossover to Sonic’s movie canon, as seen at the end of Sonic the Hedgehog 3 .

7 Shadow the Hedgehog

"Edgy The Hedgy"

Shadow was designed as the dark mirror image of Sonic, and is known for his brooding and mysterious personality and tragic backstory. This enticed fans from the start and thus, since his debut, shadow has always been one of the most popular Sonic characters. In fact, his popularity alone caused Sega to resurrect him for future games, since in his debut title Sonic Adventure 2 , he was meant to have perished saving the world.

Shadow has a very well-developed backstory, and experiences arguably the most character growth out of anyone else, as he moves from a villain to an anti-hero and Sonic’s long-standing rival. Even if his own spin-off title was rather questionable for many, Shadow is a stalwart member of Sonic’s large cast and fans love him for the air of mystery and edginess he brings to the table.

8 Silver the Hedgehog

Iconic Look And Character Arc

With an interesting character design that is completely unique from Sonic and Shadow's predecessors, Silver brought something completely new to the franchise yet appealed largely to what was already established. Hailing from a post-apocalyptic future, Silver can time travel, and thus, his futuristic look made him appeal to many, even if his debut game doesn’t stand out as one of the best for most fans.

Known for his desire for world peace, Silver had a desperate struggle to fight for his future, which saw him get manipulated frequently by the evil Mephiles, and was first posed as another rival and enemy for Sonic. Silver is friendly yet extremely powerful and his move set and abilities bring something completely new to the franchise.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered: A Brotherhood Betrayed Quest Guide
item.description:
A Brotherhood Betrayed is one of the main side quests that players can encounter when they visit the town of Bruma in The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered . The town is buzzing with rumors after local recluse Bradon Lirrian was murdered by a vampire hunter from out of town, but the guards and Bradon's wife task Oblivion Remastered players with discovering the truth behind this supposed vampire slaying.

This side quest has a few outcomes, and it also provides multiple opportunities for Oblivion Remastered players to put their skills to use when tracking down their target. Raynil Dralas is the supposed vampire hunter from out of town, but the circumstances surrounding Bradon Lirrian 's death are incredibly suspicious. There's only a limited amount of time before Raynil Dralas gets away with everything, so players shouldn't wait to get to the bottom of things.

How to Start A Brotherhood Betrayed in Oblivion Remastered

This quest begins in the town of Bruma in the northern part of Cyrodiil. Most NPCs will talk about the death of Bradon Lirrian when asked about rumors , but the player can head directly to the Lirrian house at the southern edge of town to start the quest as well. According to the guards and Bradon's wife Erline, a Dunmer named Raynil Dranas killed Bradon because he was secretly a vampire . Corpses in the basement of the Lirrians' house with bite marks on their necks appear to confirm their suspicions, so it seems like an open and shut case at first glance.

Where to Find Reynil Dralas

The player is tasked with digging deeper into Bradon's murder, and the first step is tracking down Reynil Dralas. Nobody seems to know where he is, though, and he's a hard man to find. Asking the NPCs around town will eventually reveal that Reynil is staying at Olav's Tap and Tack , so that's the next place to look.

At the inn, Olav will tell the player more information about Reynil as long as his Disposition towards the player is high enough. The persuasion minigame should be enough to raise his Disposition, but a bribe will suffice if the player's Speechcraft skill is too low. Olav will hand players the key to Reynil's room for further investigation. To continue the quest, pick up Gelebourne's Journal hidden behind the dresser in Reynil's room.

Defeating Raynil Dralas

Gelebourne's Journal is the key to A Brotherhood Betrayed, containing the truth behind the murder of Bradon Lirrian. Reynil and Bradon were adventurers together, but Reynil killed Bradon and their other partner, Gelebourne, to secure their secret treasure for himself. To continue the quest, deliver the journal to the guards in Bradon's house.

Carius, the guard overseeing this murder case, will instruct the player to meet him at Olav's Tack and Tap in an hour. At the meeting, he'll send the player to Boreal Stone Cave to track down Reynil Dralas and bring him to justice. Players only have one in-game day to find him, otherwise he'll escape. Reynil refuses to go down without a fight at Boreal Stone Cave, so players must slay him to complete the quest.

Once Reynil is defeated, return to Bruma and speak to Bradon's wife, Erline, to complete the quest. She'll reveal the secret power of the coveted amulet. Instead of a Mundane Amulet , it's actually the Phylactery of Litheness . This amulet grants the Fortify Speed effect, allowing Oblivion Remastered players to travel the land more quickly.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered: The Order of the Virtuous Blood Quest Walkthrough
item.description:
Oblivion Remastered has several major and minor factions in its world that players can join and complete quests for. Order of the Virtuous Blood is one such quest that allows you to join a faction of Vampire Hunters, and lets you get rewards for each time you bring back a trophy. However, before you join the faction, you'll need to complete a quest involving identifying the faction member, who is secretly a vampire.

How to Start the Order of the Virtuous Blood Quest in Oblivion Remastered

Players can start the Order of the Virtuous Blood quest by simply arriving at the Imperial City Temple District in Oblivion Remastered . After waiting a few minutes here, players will get a visit from Ralsa Norvalo, who'll ask for their help in an urgent matter. You'll be prompted to enter Seridur's House in the same district, where he'll introduce the Order of the Virtuous Blood faction to you.

Before players can join this faction, they'll need to investigate a person accused of being a vampire, Ronald Jenseric. Simply head to Ronald's house and check the little note on the dining table, over a book, to figure out the whereabouts of the alleged vampire. Head to Ronald Jenseric's Cabin , east of the Imperial City, to visit him.

Should You Kill Roland Jenseric or Spare Him?

Upon talking to Ronald, he'll clarify that the real vampire is Seridur, and players must believe him. Here, you'll have a choice to believe Ronald's story and spare him, or call him out on his lie and deliver swift justice.

  • If players choose to eliminate Ronald, the quest will end once players return to Seridur to inform him about his death.
  • If players choose to spare Ronald, the quest will continue and will allow players to join the faction down the line.

Joining the Order of the Virtuous Blood Faction

If players go with the non-violent option , they can ask Ronald more about Seridur. Ronald will tell players to visit the merchant at the First Edition shop in the Merchant's district of Imperial City. Once you visit the merchant, he'll tell players how Seridur likes to visit the Memorial Cave, and he was under the assumption that some of his loved ones are buried there.

Heading over the Memorial Cave and heading down the dark caverns, players will encounter Seridur, and it will lead to a boss fight with him. After defeating the vampire, return to Ronald to deliver him the good news. Ronald will be relieved to know that he can finally leave the confines of his home, as he's free from the fear of Seridur.

Now, head over to Seridur's House's basement one more time to talk to Ronald. He'll be taking charge of the Order of the Virtuous Blood and making you an honorary member of it. Players will also receive the Ring of Sunfire as a reward for completing the Order of the Virtuous Blood quest in Oblivion Remastered .

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Over 40 Steam Games Are Up to 90% Off Until May 12
item.description:
Summary

  • Curve Games' Steam sale offers up to 90% off on 40 titles, amounting to $481.57 in combined savings.
  • The newly launched sale runs until May 12.

Over 40 Steam titles have been treated to generous price cuts—with discounts reaching up to 90%—as part of a new publisher sale launched by Curve Games. Steam users have until May 12 to take advantage of this fresh batch of deals.

Curve Games Ltd is a British video game publisher and former developer based out of London. Founded in 2005, the company ceased original game development by 2014, pivoting exclusively to publishing. Over the following decade, Curve Games has published dozens of titles for PC, consoles, and mobile devices.

A decent chunk of that catalog has now been treated to generous discounts, courtesy of Curve's latest Steam publisher sale, which kicked off on April 28. The newly introduced promotion encompasses price cuts on 43 titles, ranging from action and sports games to adventures, platformers, and even one lawn-mowing simulator. Taking every single included deal into account, the Curve Games Steam Publisher offers exactly $481.57 in combined savings.

Apart from half a dozen sub-$1 games, one of the highlights from the current batch of deals is a 60% discount on Dungeons of Hinterberg , bringing its price down to $9.19—nearly $6 below its previous low. Developed by Austria-based studio Microbird, the game is a curious genre hybrid that blends dungeon-crawling, puzzle-solving, platforming, and social sim elements into a distinctive package likely to appeal to a wide range of RPG fans. Its elaborate social events, interwoven with deadly dungeons, give Dungeons of Hinterberg a Persona -like feel.

Another unique Curve-published title currently on sale is You Suck at Parking , an unconventional arcade game billed as the world’s only parking racer. The objective of the game is to stop in a designated parking spot as quickly as possible, but while avoiding a wide variety of obstacles, ranging from everyday items like magnets and seesaws to more hazardous elements such as landmines and teleportation portals. Currently available at 80% off, or $3.99, You Suck at Parking also offers wacky multiplayer sessions for up to eight players.

The ongoing sale also features 90% discounts on ten titles, including the 2023 tactical role-playing game For the King 2 and 2016 puzzle-platformer 10 Second Ninja X . Other heavily discounted titles include Jump Stars , Porcunipine , Pumped BMX + , Pumped BMX Pro , and Qora . Rounding out this top-tier group of discounts are Smoke and Sacrifice , Stealth Inc 2 , The Indie Mixtape , and When Ski Lifts Go Wrong .

item.title: Cronos: The New Dawn May Have a Strong Competitor in the Race for Dead Space's Successor
item.description:
Ever since the release of Dead Space , several video games have attempted to replicate the atmosphere, setting, and vibe of the 2008 horror classic. Striking Distance Studios' The Callisto Protocol , for instance, was heavily inspired by the Dead Space series, from its overall story set-up to its melee combat system. It, however, wasn't able to live up to fan expectations; many derided it as a clunky, underwhelming horror game. Luckily, other companies, like Bloober Team, are also taking a crack at making a Dead Space spiritual successor. Cronos: The New Dawn , Bloober's next project, seems to be a great example of this.

Cronos: The New Dawn is the first new game from Bloober Team following its release of the critically-acclaimed Silent Hill 2 remake. It was revealed during an Xbox Partner Preview event late last year, and it's currently scheduled to come out sometime in 2025. Although Cronos: The New Dawn doesn't take place in a derelict spaceship, like Dead Space does, it features many of the elements from the iconic game, such as its close-quarters third-person combat and futuristic setting. As exciting as the upcoming game sounds, though, it may face some strong competition in the Dead Space successor market.

Displacement Could Be a Big Competitor to Cronos: The New Dawn

Displacement is an Upcoming Horror Game with Temperature-Based Gameplay Mechanics

Earlier this month, an independent developer by the name of Obelisk Studio revealed that it was working on a new original game called Displacement . This upcoming title is a first-person action-horror game that shares a lot in common with the Dead Space franchise and has a few similarities to Cronos: The New Dawn . Displacement takes place in a frozen polar station, where all of its inhabitants have fallen victim to a strange plague which has turned them insane. Players are placed into the shoes of a lone psychologist, who must make their way through this decrepit station and discover the source of this disease.

Displacement features a couple of interesting gameplay mechanics that set itself apart from other Dead Space -likes. For one, Displacement features a unique temperature system that it utilizes in multiple ways. Players have access to a special weapon that can burn or freeze enemies at will, which also has the ability to shatter obstacles, freeze locks, overheat weapons, and ignite traps. There are temperature-based puzzles in the game, as well. In some instances, players will have to redirect heat between rooms or thaw certain objects to progress through a level. Last but not least, gamers can also build their own makeshift heat sources in order to withstand the cold.

Combat in Displacement is Melee-Focused, and the Game's UI is Very Limited

Similar to the Dead Space games, Displacement primarily features melee-based combat. The game contains 20 close-range weapons, many of which have their own gory execution animations. The environments in Displacement are also highly interactive; players can use a lot of the items they find in their surroundings as improvised weapons. Although the game is in first-person, unlike Dead Space and Cronos: The New Dawn , its UI is very limited and emphasizes immersion. The original Dead Space was, likewise, notable for its minimalist approach to UI design.

Although Displacement May Be a Ways Off, it Could Steal Some Thunder from Cronos: The New Dawn

The company behind Displacement , Obelisk Studio, has been involved with the production of several titles, like Far Cry 6 , Love, Death & Robots , and Sons of the Forest , but it's never made a game of this scope before. On Obelisk Studio's official website, the company notes that its Alpha vertical slice of Displacement is almost complete. However, the game doesn't have enough funding yet and may not be completed without the support of fans. With this in mind, it's possible that Displacement may still be a ways off. Nonetheless, if it exceeds expectations, it could steal some thunder from Dead Space spiritual successors like Cronos: The New Dawn .
